intro: Iris nikitensis, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its upright, grass-like leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The flowers are composed of three upright petals and three spreading sepals, with a prominent central stigma.
